page.title: 12RELIGION
page.content: Luddesdown Church. The Church at Luddesdown, St. Peter and St. Paul, is very old, part was built in l3th Century but much was rebuilt last century. They do not have their own vicar, and only one service is held there on a Sunday. The Church is kept locked. The Church of Dode. About a mile away is the small Church of Dode, it was a ruin but has been restored this century and alienated to the Church of Rome, a service is held once a year in the Church now known as "Our Lady of the Meadows". It was deserted at the time of the plague and is now privately owned.
